DataElement.longName: Performance Status Assessment Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Scale
DataElement.definition: the ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.
DataElement.changeDescription: 5/18/16 jk moved from EDRN to MCL context CSI.    New VD and permissible values. 3/24/2017 added alt question text for CTSP task, wz.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2024.5.29 Alt SN added per ticket request CADSR0003787. ak 2023.8.23 Alt Name added per ticket request CADSR0002778. ak 8/7/2023 Added CRDC alt name, def and CSI per RFC Final text. jk;  2023.2.9 Alt Name added per ticket request CADSR0002033. ak 2022.12.20 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001812. ak

DataElementConcept.definition: The final result of a determination of  how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Compound object class with addition of assessment property. 02/22/2013 - tc - Removed retired concept C25367 and replaced with C25217.

ObjectClass.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.definition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.definition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.definition: the level of patient function scored using the modified ECOG performance status criteria.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

ValueMeaning.longName: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
ValueMeaning.definition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

Concepts.definition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light housework, office work.

ValueMeaning.longName: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light housework, office work.
ValueMeaning.definition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

Concepts.definition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

ValueMeaning.longName: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
ValueMeaning.definition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

Concepts.definition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

ValueMeaning.longName: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
ValueMeaning.definition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

Concepts.definition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

ValueMeaning.longName: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.
ValueMeaning.definition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

Concepts.definition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added OBIB alternate name and identifier DWQ 03-21-2019

ConceptualDomain.definition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.definition: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) was established in 1955. This is a cooperative group (Philadelphia, PA) funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.

ReferenceDocuments.documentText: Data element and all values comply with Clinical Data Update System (CDUS) v3.0 Release 2; follow CDUS manual for converting Karnofsky and Lansky scales to ECOG (Zubrod).
Instruction on template form: at Time of Treatment Failure (For CDUS reporting, please convert Karnofsky and Lansky scores to this modified Zubrod score)
What is the patient's performance status (measured within 28 days prior to registration)?
What was the post-operative Zubrod Performance Status obtained within 60 days prior to step 2 registration?
Performance Status Scale: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) at Time of Diagnosis
ECOG Performance status within 28 days prior to registration
ECOG Performance status within 7 days prior to registration
ECOG Performance status within 14 days prior to registration
Performance status at dx (ECOG) before treatment
ECOG Performance status within 14 days prior to Step 2 registration
ECOG Performance Status within 14 days prior to registration:
Does patient have ECOG score of 0, 1 or 2 (greater than or equal to 50% Lansky or Karnofsky)?
Does patient have AML in first relapse with bone marrow sample showing greater than or equal to 1 percent leukemic blasts by flow cytometry?
